title: The Walking Dead: Carol's 'destructive behaviour' continues in season 10
text:
Carol’s mental health will decline in The Walking Dead (Picture: AMC)

The Walking Dead’s Carol had her drug problem unearthed to viewers in the latest season 10 episode Ghosts.

Still dealing with the tragic loss of her son Henry, played by Matt Lintz, after he was killed by the Whisper leader Alpha (Samantha Morton), Carol’s mental health was seen declining in emotional scenes.

The most recent installment saw the grieving mum struggle with chilling visions of Henry as she focussed all her attention on getting her just desserts on Alpha.

And now showrunner Angela Kang has teased that the character’s self-destructive behaviour is going to continue through the series.

‘When somebody is going through that much pain, and when they have such a burning desire to have revenge, and when she really wants to see Alpha pay for her sins, that’s going to have a big impact on all our people in various ways,’ Kang said.

She continued to Entertainment Weekly: ‘You’re also seeing the start of some pretty self-destructive behaviors in this episode.

‘So the season builds from there with her story. So yeah, it’s a continuing story for us.

‘It has a lot of emotional depth from her character side.’

We don’t know if our hearts will be able to cope with this.

Besides Carol’s mental wellbeing, the latest season 10 episode left us with a lot of questions – including whether we’ll learn about Rick Grimes’ disappearance.

The Walking Dead star Norman Reedus has revealed that the show’s crew are ‘freaking out’ over ‘crazy’ upcoming storylines and honestly, we can’t wait to see how it all unfolds.

‘There are things that are gonna happen this season that are mind-blowing, and the sets are huge, it’s just nuts,’ he said at ACE Comic Con Midwest.

The Walking Dead airs Sundays at 9pm on AMC in the US and Mondays at 9pm on Fox in the UK.
